tool.name: CategoricalAndReclassTool

param.name: categorical_evidence
param.dialogReference: A Categorical evidence raster to be reclassified and divided by appropriate value

param.name: reclass_field
param.dialogReference: Enter the integer values, which will be divided by the Divisor entered below, that are to be the fuzzy membership values for the classes. The reclassify tool will only take integers. Thus if a membership of 0.3 is desired, the user would enter a 3 and the divisor would be entered below as 10.

param.name: reclassification
param.dialogReference: Enter the integer values, which will be divided by the Divisor entered below, that are to be the fuzzy membership values for the classes. The reclassify tool will only take integers. Thus if a membership of 0.3 is desired, the user would enter a 3 and the divisor would be entered below as 10.

param.name: fmcat
param.dialogReference: Enter the name of the real valued fuzzy membership raster to be created by this process.

param.name: divisor
param.dialogReference: Enter the number that is used to divide the integer fuzzy membership values in the Reclassification process. If fuzzy memberships with one significant figure are desired, use a divisor of 10 for integers in the Reclassification of 1, 2, 3, 4, ..., 10.

tool.summary: This fuzzification tool is designed create fuzzy memberships for categorical data by first reclassification to integers and then division by an appropriate value. Alternatively this tool can be used with ordered data to utilize the ArcGIS symbolization classification methods. For Categorical memberhships, the reclassification inputs might be integers between 0 and 100 with a divisor of 100. This will produce fuzzy memberships with two significant figures. By selecting an appropriate divisor, such as 10, 100, or 1000, the number of signficant figures are determined. For ordered data, a reclassification method is selected and the number of classes defined. Then the divisor will be the number of classes. This will produce fuzzy memberships from 0 to 1 with the number of significant figures determined by the number of classes.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This fuzzification tool is designed create fuzzy memberships for categorical data by first reclassification to integers and then division by an appropriate value. Alternatively this tool can be used with ordered data to utilize the ArcGIS symbolization classification methods. For Categorical memberhships, the reclassification inputs might be integers between 0 and 100 with a divisor of 100. This will produce fuzzy memberships with two significant figures. By selecting an appropriate divisor, such as 10, 100, or 1000, the number of signficant figures are determined. For ordered data, a reclassification method is selected and the number of classes defined. Then the divisor will be the number of classes. This will produce fuzzy memberships from 0 to 1 with the number of significant figures determined by the number of classes.
